places_with_reviews.name: MTDC Ajanta Fardapur
address: Major State Highway 8, Fardapur, Thana, Maharashtra 431118, India

reviews.text: MTDC Ajanta was one of the most luxurious stays we ever had. We were the only family booked the room for the entire property. Think, how good the property is. I checked the Google reviews, YouTube videos and booked. However, the real time experience is astounding/astonishing. The property is very close to the Highway and Ajanta caves. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The property has good space for parking and walking which I loved. However, the rooms are very very old and if you come during monsoon season, come with an umbrella/rainbow jacket to tackle the water inside the room. Rooms are with cracks, lizards, centipedes, black ants, small insects. There are a lot of monkeys in the property. The bathroom is very smelly, like entering into a public toilet. Better avoid this property if you have any choice.

The non ac rooms are newly built, I checked out the AC family suites, which are old. Located on the highway and whole night one has to face traffic sound. Otherwise everything was pretty good. Stayed here for a night during my Ajanta cave visit.
Newly renovated. Rooms are spacious. Cleanliness needs an upgrade. Good service. Ample parking. In house restaurant operates for breakfast and dinner. On the highway and close to Ajanta caves.

Location is very close to Ajanta caves. Rooms are decent, but hot water issues exist. There were black ants too, but didn’t find it too problematic. One can park their cars adjacent to rooms and it is really a plus. Restaurant food is tasty and service was very nice.

I recently stayed at MTDC in Fardapur for a day during the last week of December.

The proximity to Ajanta Caves provides a stunning view, but there are some notable drawbacks.

The room rent is on the higher side (₹4.5k+ per night), and unfortunately, the service falls short of expectations.

The reception staff's lack of English proficiency creates communication challenges, especially for guests from South India who aren't fluent in Hindi.

The phone numbers listed on their website were unresponsive, making it difficult to reach the staff.

Service-wise, it was disappointing. For instance, there was no AC remote in the room initially. After requesting one, we were initially told to manage without it, and only after insistence, they provided a remote.

Moreover, the continental breakfast is limited to Upma and Poha, and the à la carte items are relatively expensive. These issues impact the overall guest experience and could be improved.

Despite the fantastic location, the high room rent, poor service, and communication barriers make it challenging to fully recommend this stay. I hope these concerns are addressed for a better guest experience. Thank you.

places_with_reviews.name: MTDC Guest House

reviews.text:
Best location .. ambience is too good...rooms are neat and clean ..old one but well maintained..very much specious.. You can see Greenary,Birds,Monkeys.

Room service is available. No restaurant.cook will prepare the food as per your order.. breakfast is complimentary .. lunch is not available.. only dinner is available as per your order . We visited in the end of March. it is hot season.. in the morning climate is very much pleasant.. but after 10 o'clock it's too hot.. the air around you is also too hot. So better to visit from the month of November to February...

The property is at a very beautiful and convenient location if visiting the Ajanta caves is the prime objective. It's easy enough to see the caves in half a day and then spend the rest of it sightseeing some other viewpoints. However, expect the usual govt neglect when staying here. It's too understaffed to be maintained properly but the people on duty did everything they could to make our stay comfortable. The dinner was good, the people were friendly and the room and washroom were clean. Overall, the stay was comfortable and peaceful.
There's no WiFi here so we were completely cut off from the world for a couple of days because Airtel doesn't work in this area. But it was a welcome break from the phones.
Only good thing about it is size of the accommodation. Food is very average in quality & quantity but costs as if it's a 5 star hotel. 1 roti / chapati costs Rs.20/-.

Very nice pleasant stay. Cottages are good. Nice plan. Those who love to stay on lonely location will love this place. There is Lake beside so nice morning walk. In night saw neelgay nearby. Lots of parking space. Huge rooms. Breakfast and dinner is good. Washrooms needs to be little clean.
Place is very near to caves bus start point. There is one fox in campus, kids love to see it. Must visit in rainy season.

If you want to stay closest to Ajanta Caves entrance, this is it. The rooms are reasonably clean and rustic, offerring bare bone comfort Ours had working A/C. Shower water was good pressure and hot, though floor drain very slow. The grounds and admin office are in decline. The kitchen is like a well worn fishing boat galley. It would be a good idea to schedule a deep cleaning. The all roles chef did make us a decent breakfast and milk coffee. Staff is attentive and courteous. Installing WIFI for guests would be an important improvement since Airtel signal is weak in the area.

places_with_reviews.name: Hotel Pawan & Lodging - Ajanta
address: Aurangabad - Ajanta - Jalgaon Rd, opposite Pavan Dhaba, Ajanta, Maharashtra 431117, India

reviews.text: Food here is one of the best on this highway. Good quality with taste and quick service. Ample parking, price are reasonable, quantity is good, The best dinning experience.
Stopped here on the way to Ajanta Caves for food and rest a bit. Food was served hot and in a hefty portion. Puri Bhajji, Poha and tea we chose which was up to the mark. The staff were very polite.
Chicken handi by sheru must have dish.... even shev sabji is also so tasty
Nice 👍  quality 1.pure veg restaurant. 2.Parking good 😊 3. Clean toilet

places_with_reviews.name: HOTEL ARYADEEP LODGING & FAMILY RESTAURANTS
address: AURANGABAD JALGAON HIGHWAY, near AJANTA CAVES, Fardapur, Thana, Maharashtra 431118, India

reviews.text:
One of the few best hotels you’ll find on this highway. It’s just on road so you will not spend time finding this hotel.
Super clean and very decent food. Staff is courteous and I would highly recommend this hotel if you’re planning to stay on this highway during your next road trip.

On my recent trip to Ajanta caves, I wanted to find a stay closer so that it would be easier for us to unpack our riding gears and visit the location.

This hotel seemed to be the only viable choice from their photos and review. Most other stay in the surrounding are poor in hygiene.

And it stood up to it. 👍

The rooms were neat and tidy, bathroom fixtures were all new and clean with hot water shower available any time.

We inadvertently opted for the terrace while booking which meant we had to climb 3 floors. They don't have an elevator/lift so this means you have to climb a lot. Rooms are available 1st floor upwards, ground floor is a bar. So it may not be kid or family friendly atmosphere. However rooms and bed are large enough for a family with kid.

Room service: They do provide room service on request, our luggage was carried by their staff and even helped checkout smoothly in the dawn the next day as we had to ride early.

Food service: They have a bar downstairs and their food is average at best and too oily and spicy to the core.🔥 We had an upset stomach the next day, suggesting people explicitly mention to dial down the oil and spice before ordering here.

For a place like Fardapur, it exceeded my expectation. Location is very convenient as it nearby the point from where one needs to get the shuttle service to Ajanta caves. The room is neat and clean with all basic amenities in place. There is no room service for dinner, but they serve tea snacks in the room. They served us dinner at the first floor restaurant / conference hall as ground floor restaurant is open to all. Food was okay and reasonably priced. I found the room rent a bit on the higher side. Wifi was not working most of the times. Staff is very polite and helpful. Very good for a short stay.

Its bar ...rates r high like mumbai or any other city .. its near  ajanta  fardapur village ..rates of whisky and berrs r high ..non ac bar.

Serving local muttton half  handi 700/- and chiken handi.

Kitchen is dirty . Non hygenic.

Lodging rooms r small with high prices Rs.2500/- chk out 11.00am.

Ajanta - jalgaon rd.

Very neat and clean place. Hotel service is great and staff is also good.
The location is really good Near Ajanta caves. Rooms are very nice and comfortable

places_with_reviews.name: Hotel Padmapani Park
address: National Highway No. 753 F Close to Ajanta caves, Fardapur, Maharashtra 431118, India

reviews.text:
Terrible Experience at Hotel Padmapani Park

My recent experience with Hotel Padmapani Park was nothing short of a nightmare. Despite having a confirmed booking, my stay at this establishment was marred by the appalling behavior of the management.

Upon reaching the hotel for check-in, we were shocked to be told that no rooms were available, despite having a confirmed reservation. The manager's dismissive attitude was incredibly frustrating, as he not only refused to accommodate us but also displayed a complete lack of empathy for our situation.

To add insult to injury, the management made no effort to find an alternative solution for us, such as arranging accommodation in nearby hotels. This was particularly distressing as it was already 7:30 PM, and we were exhausted from our visit to Ajanta.

The rudeness and lack of professionalism exhibited by the hotel's management were truly disappointing. When we inquired about the reason for this inconvenience, we were informed that the hotel prioritizes bulk bookings over individual reservations. While this may be a business decision, the complete lack of communication about this policy prior to our arrival is inexcusable.

A simple courtesy of informing us beforehand would have allowed us to make alternative arrangements. Instead, we were left stranded and had to scramble to find accommodation in an unfamiliar place.

In conclusion, my stay at Hotel Padmapani Park was a frustrating and disheartening experience. I would strongly advise against booking with this hotel unless you enjoy the prospect of being denied a room without any prior notice or assistance. The management's behavior reflects poorly on the establishment, and it is clear that customer satisfaction is not a priority for them.

We booked hotel online but during check in, the owner said- no room available but if you cancel your booking I can give you room. And the cost was double that we initially paid. At this remote area, you don't have much option & other hotels were also full that time. Forcefully we stayed there. At night it was a horrible experience.
To the hotel owner- For extra money, you ruined our ajanta trip, time & money also. You are the worst person I have ever met. Very bad experience.

For extra money he sold, prepaid & pre-booked room. Be aware friend

Had stayed in this hotel while returning from a wedding function, must say the stay was very pleasant Specially the hotel staff with name of Mr Wasim was very helpful and the hotel owner as well who literally went beyond his way and offered discount on stay . Will definitely visit again.

The hospitality and cooperation that we received at this hotel needs special mention. The room that was alloted to us was excellent. The cook personally asked for our opinion regarding the food served. All staff were extremely friendly and helpful.A stay in this hotel will enhance the enjoyment of the trip.

Very Bad experience the hotel is infested with insects. The owner of this hotel is very idiotic person did not talk politely with customer and asking for large sum of money for staying one day. Food price is high and taste is not up to the mark. Pillows are covered with hair. Keu Jate Ar kono din ei hotel ta choose kore.

reviews.text: Hotel is in the prime location nearest to Ajanta.. One of the best hotel with super service.. Room is neat and clean.. Staffs r humble and friendly.. View from room, tarrace is too nice.. Room service is also good..

2km from Ajanta caves

We met Ali and he showed us the best places to see around the caves and the market where we met the family business. He was very accomodating and told us about a different route to see the caves with less people and a great viewpoint. Clean beds, nice room, lovely stay. Thank you!!

Without doubt one of the favourite hotels that we stayed in during our time travelling around India. Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the staff and the manager. The staff were attentive, professional and friendly. The chef cooked excellent food and was very flexible which we appreciated. The manager spoke excellent English and was able to offer advice and help whenever it was needed. Our bedroom was ample size, with a comfortable bed and TV, our bathroom was clean and tidy with running hot water, everything you could want in a hotel.

places_with_reviews.name: Agrawals restaurant and lodging
address: near ajanta caves jalgaon aurangabad highway, Fardapur, Maharashtra 431118, India

reviews.text: They have parking and a restaurant downstairs. Clean bedsheet and washrooms. A bit old. Courteous staff. Good  value for night to visit the caves nearby. They accept foreigners.

I had a fantastic stay at this modest, unpretentious hotel. Don't expect great luxury, but the rooms have everything you need -- it's clean and the staff are extremely attentive and responsive. Rooms at the back are better because they have balconies and don't face the main road where you hear the traffic. Special mention must be made of the restaurant. Really excellent food, reasonably priced. I stayed there for four days and ate like a king. Location is excellent for getting to the Ajanta caves, which are a miracle absolutely worth seeing. Overall excellent.

Rooms still under slight reconstruction, so experience could have been better. But the service of the staff, the warm hospitality and the delicious fresh and warm food made by them, made the stay easier. It's in a good location, near the bus stand and the Ajanta view point. Although fewer shops are available nearby, the the hotel provied us with everything essential. Overall a good place to stay.

Extremely poor service.....food quality is so poor I had never eaten such worst quality food.prices are overhyped in menu card ..there is so foul smell in the room as well as corridor....no lift is there... extremely disappointed..

Very convenient location from Ajanta caves. We went  there for dinner and were delighted to find that our food was freshly prepared in home style. They even customised our food as per requirements. We loved the taste of the  food and ordered a double serving of mix veg dry and dal fry. The chef makes excellent phulkas(indian bread) which are served hot. The owner pays attention to the food preparation and service which seems to maintain the quality. Would recommend to anyone looking for fresh and tasty food.

places_with_reviews.name: Hotel Murli Monohar

reviews.text: Nice veg food cooked in best oil.

Located about a 10 minute walk from the Ajant Tee Point, Hotel Murli Manohar is a wonderful budget choice. The rooms are simple, but well maintained and come with flat screen TV (with a good selection of Indian and international channels), hot showers and very fast WiFi. The bed linen and towels were clean as was my bathroom which was absolutely spotless. Despite it's on road location there was little traffic or street noise and the atmosphere was calm and peaceful.

There is a restaurant attached and food is available in rooms also.

Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is fine for solo women travellers also.

This is an amazing budget option in a great location.
Value for money & nice restaurant.
Good accodamation . Hotel taste is soo good .if you want visit ajinta you must stay in this one unique
